page.title: 02Garway School
page.content: There has been a school in Garway since 1875. The old school building is just up the road from the present school, which was built in 1962. The school population has varied from over 120 to the present 32. At 11, children transfer to Kingstone, or sometimes Ross-on-Wye. Very few children live near the school, and currently only one walks to school. The rest come by car or on the school bus. Only 12 pupils live within our block. The school has two classrooms, a hall and a resources area (which used to be the kitchens - school dinners are now brought by car from St. Weonards). We have a good playing field and a small swimming pool. There are two teachers, a part-time secretary, and a cleaner. This survey has been completed by a class of 20 7-11-year-olds, of whom only 6 are upper juniors.
